result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel L. Christenson

Contact with defendant's father and stepmother as allowed by the agent.

Defendant Angel L. Christenson in court with attorney Luke Steiner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 1 for dismissal/read-in of count 2.  DA also asks for amendment to bond; bond to stay in effect while def on DPA.  Def pleads no contest to count 1.  Court's colloquy.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for DPA.

Status conference on May 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Angel L. Christenson in court with attorney Luke Steiner. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. 16CF26/AIA and 16TR83/city case status.  In 16CF26, Atty. S states parties have not discussed possible resolution; notes that def wishes to waive right to prelim and request status scheduling.  Atty. S states he talked with city prosecutor in 16TR83; no offer in that matter; def pleads no contest; finding of guilty and forfeiture ordered in the TR matter.  In 16CF26, def waives right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.  Information filed.  Formal reading waived.  Court states possible max. penalties.  NG pleas entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Luke Steiner, change of law firms from Kopp McKichan, LLP to McNamara, Reinicke, Vogelsberg & Helmke, LLP

Defendant Angel L. Christenson in court with attorney Luke Steiner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charges and informs the Def of the possible max. penalties as well as her right to prelim.  Atty. Steiner waives time limits in which to hold the prelim; indicates defense may also waive the prelim itself.  At this time, Court conducts colloquy on prelim time limits only.  Defense will preserve right to have a prelim at a later date.  Court adjourns to 3/16 at 2:30; matter set as AIA as reminder prelim not yet held.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
